title: The influence of Renaissance grottoes and cabinets on modern museums
excerpt: A deep dive into Renaissance collecting practices and their lasting impact on modern museums, through the lens of Isabella d'Este's grotto and cabinets of curiosity.

title: After Hours: What Night Programs Reveal About Visitor Behavior
excerpt: Insights from my ongoing visitor studies research at Melbourne Museum, examining how after-hours programming creates different social dynamics and visitor engagement patterns compared to daytime visits.

title: Building Bridges: Cross-Cultural Collaboration in Contemporary Art
excerpt: Reflections on curating "Sensitive Being" with artists from four different countries, and the unique challenges and opportunities that arise when bringing together diverse cultural perspectives in a single exhibition.

title: Creating Safe Spaces: Art Therapy and Community Building
excerpt: How art-making workshops can serve as platforms for cultural exchange, emotional healing, and community building among international students and local communities in Melbourne.

title: The Future of Art Documentation: Digital Archiving Best Practices
excerpt: Lessons learned from working on ISEA International's digital archiving project, including metadata standardization, automation tools, and the importance of preserving digital art and conference materials for future researchers.

title: Navigating Melbourne's Arts Ecosystem as an International Student
excerpt: Personal reflections on building connections within Melbourne's vibrant arts community, from gallery openings to artist studios, and finding one's place as a curator in a new cultural context.
